incidents.name: Intermittent error rates affecting cache, waf, workers and pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to recover. Additional impact: Customers pushing new Cloudflare Pages deployments may experience rate-limiting failures.
System continues to be stable, and we are monitoring recovery.  No further impact is expected at this time.
System continues to be stable, and we are monitoring recovery.  No further impact is expected at this time.
System is stable, we are still monitoring recovery
We are nearing full recovery and will continue to monitor
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We have experienced an increase in intermittent error rates affecting cache, WAF and Workers returning a 500 error when adding or modify an object/setting. The root cause has been identified and a fix is in place. We are monitoring closely. The majority of impact ended around 1:47 UTC. Areas of impact included AMS, HKG and LIS.

incidents.name: IAD (Ashburn) on 2023-08-03

incident_updates.body: The maintenance has been completed.

affected_components.name: North America - Ashburn, VA, United States - (IAD)

incident_updates.body: We were performing a maintenance in IAD (Ashburn) datacentre on 2023-08-03 between 05:30 and 11:00 UTC. It is possible that traffic was re-routed from this location, hence there was a possibility of a slight increase in latency during this maintenance window for end-users in the affected region. For PNI / CNI customers connecting with us in this location, traffic would fail over elsewhere during this maintenance window as network interfaces in this datacentre were temporarily unavailable.

affected_components.name: North America - Ashburn, VA, United States - (IAD)
